Author: Trusty#8181
Content: hi guys, i've a quick question on atomic dex, if I have orders open the phone has to be on and connected to the internet for possible matching? If I shut down the phone the orders are still matchable? I asking because in other dex like bisq etc. is that way.

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: As it is peer to peer, if a peer shuts down, you cannot match orders anymore

Author: Goku#9007
Content:
@Trusty
On bisq you can't shutdown your computer as well

Content: ty

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
i found the problem: someone bought all ETH from that node, so there is not enough ETH left to pay txfees for other ERC20 tokens
the only solution to this problem is to disable ETH orders... and that is what i will do now...

Author: jorian#4555
Content: that's what i expected

Author: jorian#4555
Content: it might be an idea to remove orders from the orderbook for ERC20 tokens, once ETH doesn't have balance.

Author: jorian#4555
Content: but not sure if that is a workable solution

Author: ca333#0118
Content: or keep the ETH orders and just set max. volume to a value under the ETH balance to not run into the same situation again

Author: ca333#0118
Content: it would be like "reserving" the diff. between maxvol and balance for ERC trades

Author: jorian#4555
Content: could also work

Author: cipi#4502
Content: orders are updated every minute... with `max:true`, i do not check the balance before posting orders

Author: cipi#4502
Content: ok, DAI swaps should work again... ETH orders removed...

Author: omisu#6895
Content:
I cant send to other btc wallet from atomic btc wallet.
How can i pick up it from atomicdex wallet.
My device is android os.

Author: Markus#5464
Content: @omisu you have to use a legacy btc recieving address, starting with a "1", segwit addresses are not supported yet

Author: omisu#6895
Content: where can i get starting with a 1 address?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @omisu to which btc wallet are you sending?

Author: omisu#6895
Content:
oh I found it,My using exchange address is starting with 3 but other one is made with starting 1~~~~. 
I solved that, thank you Markus and gcharang for taking care about me.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
sorry, 
<https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/atomicdex/atomicdex-tutorials/atomicdex-walkthrough.html>
in the step that says "Setting Up the Coin List"
you can add the coin you are interested in

for now, most BTC forks and ERC20 are supported out of the box
<https://github.com/jl777/coins> -- see read me here and the files to know how to add a new coin

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@HighOnLife this is for adding to the cli, which you can do locally for yourself and submit a PR along with the proof of swaps (5 txns) - this is free
for adding into the atomicDEX mobile, there is a listing fee
